trans-unit.source: Provision a SQL Server virtual machine in Azure
trans-unit.target: Provision a SQL Server virtual machine in Azure

trans-unit.source: This tutorial teaches you how to create and configure a SQL Server VM on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial teaches you how to create and configure a SQL Server VM on Azure.

trans-unit.source: The Azure virtual machine gallery includes several images that contain Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: The Azure virtual machine gallery includes several images that contain Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: You can select one of the virtual machine images from the gallery and with a few clicks you can provision the virtual machine to your Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: You can select one of the virtual machine images from the gallery and with a few clicks you can provision the virtual machine to your Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will:
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to the Azure management portal and provision a virtual machine from the gallery</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to the Azure management portal and provision a virtual machine from the gallery</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open the virtual machine using Remote Desktop and complete setup</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open the virtual machine using Remote Desktop and complete setup</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Complete configuration steps to connect to the virtual machine using SQL Server Management Studio on another computer</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Complete configuration steps to connect to the virtual machine using SQL Server Management Studio on another computer</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title> using your account.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title> using your account.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an Azure account, visit <linkText>Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an Azure account, visit <linkText>Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page, click +NEW, click COMPUTE, click VIRTUAL MACHINE, and then click FROM GALLERY.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure Management Portal, at the bottom left of the web page, click +NEW, click COMPUTE, click VIRTUAL MACHINE, and then click FROM GALLERY.

trans-unit.source: On the Choose an Image page, click SQL SERVER.
trans-unit.target: On the Choose an Image page, click SQL SERVER.

trans-unit.source: Then select a SQL Server image.
trans-unit.target: Then select a SQL Server image.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow at the bottom right of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow at the bottom right of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose an Image</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose an Image</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For the most up-to-date information on the supported SQL Server images on Azure, see <linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines Overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the most up-to-date information on the supported SQL Server images on Azure, see <linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines Overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you have a virtual machine created by using the platform image SQL Server Evaluation edition, you cannot upgrade it to a per-minute paid edition image in the gallery.
trans-unit.target: If you have a virtual machine created by using the platform image SQL Server Evaluation edition, you cannot upgrade it to a per-minute paid edition image in the gallery.

trans-unit.source: You can choose one of the following two options:
trans-unit.target: You can choose one of the following two options:

trans-unit.source: You can create a new virtual machine by using the per-minute paid SQL Server edition from the gallery and migrate your database files to this new virtual machine by following the steps at <linkText>Migrating a Database to SQL Server on an Azure VM</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: You can create a new virtual machine by using the per-minute paid SQL Server edition from the gallery and migrate your database files to this new virtual machine by following the steps at <linkText>Migrating a Database to SQL Server on an Azure VM</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Or, you can upgrade an existing instance of SQL Server Evaluation edition to a different edition of SQL Server under the <linkText>License Mobility through Software Assurance on Azure</linkText><title></title> agreement by following the steps at <linkText>Upgrade to a Different Edition of SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can upgrade an existing instance of SQL Server Evaluation edition to a different edition of SQL Server under the <linkText>License Mobility through Software Assurance on Azure</linkText><title></title> agreement by following the steps at <linkText>Upgrade to a Different Edition of SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to purchase the licensed copy of SQL Server, see <linkText>How to Buy SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to purchase the licensed copy of SQL Server, see <linkText>How to Buy SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: On the first Virtual Machine Configuration page, provide the following information:
trans-unit.target: On the first Virtual Machine Configuration page, provide the following information:

trans-unit.source: A VERSION RELEASE DATE.
trans-unit.target: A VERSION RELEASE DATE.

trans-unit.source: If multiple images are available, select the latest.
trans-unit.target: If multiple images are available, select the latest.

trans-unit.source: A unique VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME.
trans-unit.target: A unique VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME.

trans-unit.source: In the NEW USER NAME box, a unique user name for the machine's local administrator account.
trans-unit.target: In the NEW USER NAME box, a unique user name for the machine's local administrator account.

trans-unit.source: In the NEW PASSWORD box, type a strong password.
trans-unit.target: In the NEW PASSWORD box, type a strong password.

trans-unit.source: In the CONFIRM PASSWORD box, retype the password.
trans-unit.target: In the CONFIRM PASSWORD box, retype the password.

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate SIZE from the drop down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate SIZE from the drop down list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VM Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VM Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The size of the virtual machine is specified during provisioning:
trans-unit.target: The size of the virtual machine is specified during provisioning:

trans-unit.source: A2 is the smallest size recommended for production workloads.
trans-unit.target: A2 is the smallest size recommended for production workloads.

trans-unit.source: The minimum recommended size for a virtual machine is A3 when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: The minimum recommended size for a virtual machine is A3 when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: Select A3 or higher when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: Select A3 or higher when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: Select A4 or higher when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads images.
trans-unit.target: Select A4 or higher when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Transactional Workloads images.

trans-unit.source: Select A7 or higher when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Data Warehousing Workloads images.
trans-unit.target: Select A7 or higher when using SQL Server 2012 or 2014 Enterprise Optimized for Data Warehousing Workloads images.

trans-unit.source: For the best performance use DS2 or DS3 with Premium Storage.
trans-unit.target: For the best performance use DS2 or DS3 with Premium Storage.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The size selected limits the number of data disks you can configure.
trans-unit.target: The size selected limits the number of data disks you can configure.

trans-unit.source: For most up-to-date information on available virtual machine sizes and the number of data disks that you can attach to a virtual machine, see <linkText>Virtual Machine Sizes for Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For most up-to-date information on available virtual machine sizes and the number of data disks that you can attach to a virtual machine, see <linkText>Virtual Machine Sizes for Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After entering your VM configuration details, click the next arrow on the bottom right to continue.
trans-unit.target: After entering your VM configuration details, click the next arrow on the bottom right to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the second Virtual machine configuration page, configure resources for networking, storage, and availability:
trans-unit.target: On the second Virtual machine configuration page, configure resources for networking, storage, and availability:

trans-unit.source: In the Cloud Service box, choose Create a new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: In the Cloud Service box, choose Create a new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: In the Cloud Service DNS Name box, provide the first portion of a DNS name of your choice, so that it completes a name in the format TESTNAME.cloudapp.net
trans-unit.target: In the Cloud Service DNS Name box, provide the first portion of a DNS name of your choice, so that it completes a name in the format TESTNAME.cloudapp.net

trans-unit.source: Select a SUBSCRIPTION, if you have multiple subscriptions to choose from.
trans-unit.target: Select a SUBSCRIPTION, if you have multiple subscriptions to choose from.

trans-unit.source: The choice determines which *storage accounts *are available.
trans-unit.target: The choice determines which *storage accounts *are available.

trans-unit.source: In the REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: In the REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK box, select a region where this virtual image will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: In the Storage Account, automatically generate an account, or select one from the list.
trans-unit.target: In the Storage Account, automatically generate an account, or select one from the list.

trans-unit.source: Change the SUBSCRIPTION to see more accounts.
trans-unit.target: Change the SUBSCRIPTION to see more accounts.

trans-unit.source: In the AVAILABILITY SET box, select (none).
trans-unit.target: In the AVAILABILITY SET box, select (none).

trans-unit.source: Read and accept the legal terms.
trans-unit.target: Read and accept the legal terms.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark in the bottom right corner to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark in the bottom right corner to continue.

trans-unit.source: Wait while Azure prepares your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Wait while Azure prepares your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Expect the virtual machine status to proceed through:
trans-unit.target: Expect the virtual machine status to proceed through:

trans-unit.source: Starting (Provisioning)
trans-unit.target: Starting (Provisioning)

trans-unit.source: Stopped
trans-unit.target: Stopped

trans-unit.source: Starting (Provisioning)
trans-unit.target: Starting (Provisioning)

trans-unit.source: Running (Provisioning)
trans-unit.target: Running (Provisioning)

trans-unit.source: Running
trans-unit.target: Running

trans-unit.source: When provisioning completes, click on the name of your virtual machine to go to the DASHBOARD page.
trans-unit.target: When provisioning completes, click on the name of your virtual machine to go to the DASHBOARD page.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click Connect.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click Connect.

trans-unit.source: Click the Open button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Open button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click the Open button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click the Open button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: At the Windows Security dialog box, click Use another account.
trans-unit.target: At the Windows Security dialog box, click Use another account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Use another account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Use another account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the name of the machine as the domain name, followed by your administrator name in this format: machinename\username.
trans-unit.target: Use the name of the machine as the domain name, followed by your administrator name in this format: machinename\username.

trans-unit.source: Type your password and connect to the machine.
trans-unit.target: Type your password and connect to the machine.

trans-unit.source: The first time you log on, several processes will complete, including setup of your desktop, Windows updates, and completion of the Windows initial configuration tasks (sysprep).
trans-unit.target: The first time you log on, several processes will complete, including setup of your desktop, Windows updates, and completion of the Windows initial configuration tasks (sysprep).

trans-unit.source: After Windows sysprep completes, SQL Server setup completes configuration tasks.
trans-unit.target: After Windows sysprep completes, SQL Server setup completes configuration tasks.

trans-unit.source: These tasks make cause a delay of a few minutes while they complete.
trans-unit.target: These tasks make cause a delay of a few minutes while they complete.

trans-unit.source: SELECT @@SERVERNAME may not return the correct name until SQL Server setup completes, and SQL Server Management Studio may not be visable on the start page.
trans-unit.target: SELECT @@SERVERNAME may not return the correct name until SQL Server setup completes, and SQL Server Management Studio may not be visable on the start page.

trans-unit.source: Once you are connected to the virtual machine with Windows Remote Desktop, the virtual machine works much like any other computer.
trans-unit.target: Once you are connected to the virtual machine with Windows Remote Desktop, the virtual machine works much like any other computer.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the default instance of SQL Server with SQL Server Management Studio (running on the virtual machine) in the normal way.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the default instance of SQL Server with SQL Server Management Studio (running on the virtual machine) in the normal way.

trans-unit.source: If you can connect to an instance of SQL Server running on an Azure virtual machine by using Management Studio, you should be able to connect by using a connection string similar to the following.
trans-unit.target: If you can connect to an instance of SQL Server running on an Azure virtual machine by using Management Studio, you should be able to connect by using a connection string similar to the following.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>How to Troubleshoot Connecting to the SQL Server Database Engine</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>How to Troubleshoot Connecting to the SQL Server Database Engine</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You've seen how to create and configure a SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine using the platform image.
trans-unit.target: You've seen how to create and configure a SQL Server on an Azure virtual machine using the platform image.

trans-unit.source: In many cases, the next step is to migrate your databases to this new SQL Server VM.
trans-unit.target: In many cases, the next step is to migrate your databases to this new SQL Server VM.

trans-unit.source: For database migration guidance, see <linkText>Migrating a Database to SQL Server on an Azure VM</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For database migration guidance, see <linkText>Migrating a Database to SQL Server on an Azure VM</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following list provides additional resources for SQL Server in Azure virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The following list provides additional resources for SQL Server in Azure virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines Overview</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines Overview</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security Considerations for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security Considerations for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>High Availability and Disaster Recovery for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>High Availability and Disaster Recovery for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backup and Restore for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backup and Restore for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server Business Intelligence in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server Business Intelligence in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Understand Azure SQL Database and SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Understand Azure SQL Database and SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Patterns and Development Strategies for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>
